rComments: Con: Speaks way too fast. Pros: Extremely approachable and explains very well. Mcneill is a solid choice
Worst Prof I ever had at UofT. His teaching style is fundamentally flawed and incentivizes cheating. Pray for your life that you get a curve. Avoid him AT ALL COST.

I believe Professor McNeil was made in an economics laboratory. He is the most average professor possible. His lectures are fine. His grading is fine. His extra assistance is fine. He doesn't go above and beyond to provide extra assistance, but he provides some. He is lecture slides aren't incredibly clear, but you can make sense of them. He's fine
teacherRatingTags: ['Accessible outside class', 'Test heavy', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: the worst professor in the economics department, i used all the resources possible, repeated past exams, practice questions, did everything possible and still got a subpar grade. the entire lecture was neglected resources. 0/10 recommend and avoid at all costs

An incompetent, uncaring prof. His lectures are bad (speaks too fast). He is uncaring in many ways, such as posting the slides literally 3 hours before we need them, making it hard for us to print them. His tests are pretty difficult, so gotta work for success. His one-to-one explanations are great, however, so going to his office hours helps.

To his credit, Prof. McNeill is a great lecturer. He explains the basic concepts really well, however his exams are a whole other story. He likes to throw curveball questions that aren't on tutorial problem sets or previous exams, meaning you have to be quite solid on the conceptual foundations of the content in order to do well on the exams.

charming prof, despite a harsh marking scheme and difficult midterm structure, really think he receives more slack than he deserves. Stays beyond office hour time to advise on materials outside of class material. Took his class for both 200 and 210 and can say that I genuinely enjoyed both courses
handsome guy but like one UofT redditor puts it, he's a proper stalinist. having said that, he will probably leave you at a better place in microeconomics

His inexperience shines through, be it vague/unnecessary slides/lectures, shallow reviews/tutorials and his inability to handle the student-prof dynamic. You're totally on your own and don't you dare think you have it under control because the resources you have to work with pales in comparison to actual evaluations.

He is a very nice and funny prof. However, be prepared for types of test questions and situations within those questions that haven't shown up in class or practice problems. The marking is also quite stringent.
teacherRatingTags: ['Tough grader', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Test heavy']

rComments: Bad. His lectures are mediocre at best, and he is super irresponsible regarding email response and provides minimal assistance regarding practice questions. He is still pretty helpful in one-to-one conversation, so asking questions in person would be a good strategy. Having said that, it requires lots of techniques to get good grades in his class.

his midterm consists of stuff you have not seen in class or any of the practice problems. For the sake of an example, for last midterm he posted a practice midterm of his,which had 4 questions with 100 min time limit, but the actual midterm turned out to have 6 questions(with much longer parts) and 90 mins. Cruel
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Participation matters', 'Tough grader']

rComments: The problem sets, past midterms that he posts are in no way similar to his midterms. The midterm was extremely long, and I ended up getting a low grade eve though I attended every lecture, did perfectly fine in in-class quizzes and finished all the practice questions he has posted. Not a fair professor at all, doesnt care about his students.

Even if you attended class, made good notes and do all the practice questions/tutorial questions he throws at you, it is almost impossible to finish the midterm exam as he complicates derivatives/numbers on the test which already requires much more time. He adds an insane amount of questions that the exam time just doesn't allow you to finish
I found this course is very useful and interesting. You can really learn things from this course. And for courses with useful knowledge, this one is not hard. Worth to take it!
I LOVE HIS CLASS. didn't do too well in the midterm BUT his class is so much fun really. looking for bird courses? dont take this. Looking to ACTUALLY LEARN in the uni? Take it, with him

Took his ECO200 last year. He would leave some blank slides for you to focus the lectures, and icliker questions during class time also for marks. Tutorial questions would be covered by TAs. Course is hard, need to practice every question on tutorials to get marks.

leave him as far as possible! His class materials are hard to understand, and exams 80% you wont see in his class, weekly practice, and exam practice. If u wanna waste ur money and time, hes the best choice u can have in uoft

Avoid like the plague. Small vicious man who loves to throw his weight around. You will have ZERO material to prepare for. He has not posted a single problem that has a solution all year, midterms are impossible, etc. He will test you on a concept you didn't know existed (nor was taught)
good

He deliberately makes the slides empty for you to fill in, so if you skip class you won't know anything at all. He doesnt post the complete slides after and expect you to come to class. He loves math so if you are not a math person you are so screwed for the tests. He makes the math part of the test harder, not the actual content parts harder.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Tough grader', 'Lecture heavy']

rComments: Like other reviews say, he's unexperienced. His syllabus lacks structure and he provides vague information on what tests and exams are going to be like. Often I'd review everything I though I knew in the course, and it turned out that there was an entire concept that he added on the test that I had not seen in any of the class notes or textbook.

Inexperienced in teaching! give quiz right after his lecture without any chance for students to digest for knowledge. Moreover, do not release marks for the quizzes and do not release solutions for it. AWFUL!

I honestly can't believe that this guy is UofT prof. I truly think I should be reimbursed for taking this horrible class. I'm really lost for words. Never have I been in such an unorganized class that little-no way of support to the students. Honestly avoid.

Gives very weird quizzes that you must prepare beforehand in class and does it whenever he wants like 30 minutes after class starts or at the end of class or after the end of tutorial. Literally no consistency in timing which is pretty frustrating. And his midterm is unreasonably hard and way too long. Avoid this prof, worst class I've had.
teacherRatingTags: ['Beware of pop quizzes', "Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Tough grader']

rComments: Too inexperienced, just skip him.

Never knew how to properly and specifically inform us about his office hours. Sends out practise questions before the tests with many errors, and when he sends out the solutions they're usually filled with mistakes. Doesn't post hw answers, so if u miss tutorial then ur screwed. Slides he posts dont aren't detailed. Oh my goodness, such a bad prof.

The lecture slides are clear and well organized although he speaks very fast. Still can get a comparatively good grade even if you are no majoring in economics, so long as you complete every tutorial problems.
Took 200 with him in 2016-17. Great lecturer, knows a lot about the material, very helpful during office hours. But can confirm he talks REALLY fast, be ready to ask him to repeat.
detailed lectures with lots of examples, he speaks clear, but really fast dou, per haps a little too fast, need a good english background
